channel.title: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3
channel.description:
Gabe Newell talks with deaf people about sign language and implementation of it in the game. See for yourself:
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Np5KTAm7kac[/url]

item.title: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3
item.dc:creator: George
item.description:
That’s funny. Because if not for the sign language, Gordon wouldn’t even know Barney needed help even he’s hanging off a cliff. Har.

Read full topic
item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

item.title: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
DenDrio:

VALVe might make a sign-language only version of EP3 for the Deaf community, but that’ll take A LOT of work >.<

Barney (hanging off a cliff by his fingers): “Gordon…help…oh, uh, I mean…” begins signing… “Ohshi-” :fffuuu:

Read full topic
item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

item.title: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3
item.dc:creator: DenDrio
item.description:
There might be minor characters using sign language, for example: Magnusson is having a conversation with a deaf guy using sign language, the deaf person then leaves and Magnusson tells Gordon what he says. At least that’s how I’m thinking they’re going to implement it…

VALVe might make a sign-language only version of EP3 for the Deaf community, but that’ll take A LOT of work >.<

Read full topic
item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

item.title: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Omega_Absolute:

Sign language uses hand shapes, orientation and movement of the hands, arms or body, and facial expressions to convey a particular person’s thoughts. Dog lacks not only the necessary number of fingers, but also critical facial features to convey many recognizable expressions.
https://gadgets.boingboing.net/dog-jumping.jpg

Okay, other way around then?

Read full topic
item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

item.title: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
Oh now I just feel dumb. Thanks for clearing that up

Read full topic

item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

item.title: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3
item.dc:creator: JohnWorfin
item.description:
Ballsopt:

I can’t Imagine why Alyx would just now start speaking to Dog in sign language, when she hadn’t before.

valve has loose continuity between games. mostly because of customer input and that technological developments in video games change so fast. alyx going from an explosion to the g-mans pawn or magnussen and the casserole debacle are prime examples. marc laidlaw in an email reply described briefly the evolving nature of the games, from hl1 to all the episodes. sometimes something like the guards following you became an integral part of the story and change how the game is developed or played.

Read full topic
item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

item.title: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
danielsangeo:

I have a feeling that it’ll be DOG that is signing to Alyx

Oh wow… There happens to be 1 critical problem with your theory…

Read full topic
item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

I saw this a while back, and it sounds very interesting, but useless to most of their players.

item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

item.title: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
For some reason, I have an idea that it won’t be an old friend…or any human being at all. I have a feeling that it’ll be DOG that is signing to Alyx over a viewscreen because the audio transmission is out…or because DOG or Alyx can’t make any noise for some reason…

But, it could be a deaf friend of Alyx’s… Lot of possibilities.

Read full topic
item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

item.title: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3
item.dc:creator: Ballsopt
item.description:
I can’t Imagine why Alyx would just now start speaking to Dog in sign language, when she hadn’t before.

Read full topic
item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

item.title: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3
item.dc:creator: JohnWorfin
item.description:
alyx’s old dude was deaf. The sign language will most likely be to communicate between her and dog. valve has a thing for being a little opaque on characters. When it was stated that another character from black mesa would be met in ep2, all you heard was “OMG i hope/feel/bet/want that we get to see adrian shepard” but all we got was a new character that nobody had met before that was tied to black mesa with a little bit of reverse continuity involving a microwave caserole. So i would be willing to bet that the old boyfriend is already dead and the ASL will be a game play device and a way to court deaf gamers

Read full topic
item.source: Gabe newell - Sign language may be implemented in Ep3

item.description:
George:

Uh huh. Uh huh. Da da da.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hSwJ2rjUSdc

you shoulda used this, :retard:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lVpoQGBlxrY

LoserMan255:

That would ruin the atmosphere of Half Life just as much as if Gordon would speak

We still don’t know how exactly it’s going to be implemented, so let’s not jump to conclusions
